lead_paragraph: A failure to secure debt relief before 2017 could spell a new round of political and economic instability in the country, and Europe as a whole.

byline.contributor: Liz Alderman reported from Paris, and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens.
byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN and NIKI KITSANTONIS

headline.print_headline: Trump’s Victory Rattles Greece as It Seeks Stability
headline.main: Greece, Seeking Dose of Stability, Is Rattled by Trump’s Win

snippet: A failure to secure debt relief before 2017 could spell a new round of political and economic instability in the country, and Europe as a whole....
abstract: Election of Donald Trump has left Greece uncertain about whether it will receive support from United States for its efforts to get its finances in order; Greek Prime Min Alexis Tsipras had hoped before election that Pres Obama could advocate on Greece's behalf with its European creditors during his upcoming visit, which is no longer possible.
